parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the brake system can cause the brake pedal to go to the floor, leading to a loss of braking ability, which can result in accidents, injuries, or fatalities.
symptoms: The brake pedal goes to the floor
brake fluid leaks
brake pedal feels soft or spongy
chunks fall off the rotors
excessive pressure is required to stop the vehicle
vehicle takes longer to stop than usual.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the crankshaft position sensor can cause the engine to stall, leading to a loss of power and potentially causing accidents or leaving the driver stranded.
symptoms: The engine stalls
the battery/charging warning indicator illuminates
the vehicle is able to restart
the failure occurs on multiple occasions.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the crankshaft position sensor can cause the engine to stall or fail to start, which can lead to accidents, especially if the vehicle stalls while in motion or at an intersection.
symptoms: Difficulty starting the vehicle
engine stalling
vehicle shutting off while stopped
inability to restart the vehicle.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the wheel bearing sensors can cause the anti-lock braking system (ABS) to malfunction, leading to reduced braking performance, increased stopping distances, and increased risk of accidents.
symptoms: The ABS warning light illuminates on the dashboard
the brakes feel spongy or soft
the vehicle takes longer to stop
the brakes make a grinding or screeching noise
the vehicle pulls to one side while braking.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the intermediate steering shaft can cause loss of steering control, making it difficult to maneuver the vehicle, which can lead to accidents or injuries.
symptoms: Unusual noise coming from the steering column
loose or wobbly steering wheel
difficulty steering the vehicle
vibration in the steering wheel.
